Shorter than the base game, but a bit longer than blueshift and more challenging than both. [u]Half Life: Opposing Force[/u] is, like Half Life: Blue Shift, another spin-off of the famous video game Half Life.

This time, you will embark on the adventures of Corporal [u]Adrian Shepard[/u], a brave soldier from the American military, who, initially charged with capturing Gordon Freeman, will find himself having to cancel the mission and do the only more sensible thing: run away from Black Mesa at all costs!
With the help of the survivors of Black Mesa and his military companions, he will face the looming alien threat and the mysterious "agents in black", who also seem willing to hunt Gordon Freeman and eliminate anyone who dares to escape from Black Mesa.

The game proves much longer and richer in content (in fact you will be able to use many military weapons including the Desert Eagle which is a variant of the revolver, the LMG, the sniper rifle, the C4, the anti-personnel mine with laser sensor, the rocket-launcher with laser aiming system to guide missiles and even alien weapons, very useful when you run out of ammunition) and full of action compared to Half Life: Blue Shift (there are many types of aliens and zombies to face and there are the agents in black who are very tough).

The story may be trivial, but actually, like Half Life: Blue Shift, the game is another important part of the Half Life story.
In fact, through Shepard's eyes, you will be able to discover some parts of the Half Life story (for example the powerful explosion in Black Mesa, which occurred because of a bomb brought by the agents in black and tampered with by the mysterious Gman).
Well yes, even in this game you will be able to meet Gman for more than once, who will sometimes try to help you and in other times he will try to stop you.

Another peculiarity of this game is the possibility of interacting with the characters, especially with the military companions, who will give you support by fighting alongside you (there are the engineer who, equipped with the blowtorch, can open any armored door and the doctor who will provide you with medical treatment).
The problem is their intelligence which is a little bad (they tend to disperse without reason and at some point they don't follow you, as if they don't see you anymore).

The game is a lot of fun because it gives you the impression of fulfilling a real military mission and acting like a soldier and above all there are some bosses to be eliminated.

I highly recommend this game.

this is a great expansion to the first game. i'd recommend playing this with the oculus quest port. while i think it's a shame that the game only toys with the idea of playing as an hecu soldier by having you still cooperate with the science team and eventually fight the black ops instead of going all out with you fighting guards and aliens, it's still executed very well.
Great game, and great little reminders of the orginal Half Life

This is probbably the best half-life expansion and probbably the third best half-life game overall.
You can expect a great story immersive world and pretty good gunplay if you liked hl1 gunplay.
It can be difficult even on easy difficulty so you should play the first half-life.
The only cons are that sometimes if you render the game in OpenGL (which you should) you will get stuck becuse platform gets rendered bellow the floor and in one of the vent you will have to change rendering mode but then you can continue playing in OpenGL.
In conclusion this is a great game and you would be a fool for not at least trying it so what are you waiting for go go i recommend it.

Fun add-on to the original â€œHalf-Lifeâ€ that allows the player to experience the events of that game from a new perspective, namely the one of a US marine that is sent to Black Mesa on a mission that goes instantly wrong. Instead of simply rehashing elements of the main release, â€œOpposing Forceâ€ also introduces new areas, weapons and NPCs and expands on other aspects such as the team fighting mechanics and boss fights. At the same time, it still remains loyal to the original gameâ€™s immersive gameplay as well as that mix of action interspersed with puzzles. In 2020, â€œOpposing Forceâ€ looks about as dated as the original game does, and therefore may not be for everyone, but it does provide a few more hours of entertaining playtime in the â€œHalf-Lifeâ€ universe.

Very Positive

I already reviewed the original Half-life game.
And I gave that game a huge positive review.
But now it's time to review the spinoff game.
There are two half-life spinoffs of the original.
It is the Blue Shift and this Opposing Force.
Both of them are worth a play to be honest.
They expend the story in a really good way.
It's a fantastic nostalgia trip for the veterans.
There's no wonder as to why they are great.
Even after all those years, they are still gud.
These games aged very nicely, it's fantastic.
Even the music and atmosphere feels nice.
This is a piece of gaming history right here.

awsome

This is an absolutely fantastic expansion of the original half life with excellent pacing, new and creative level design, enemies, and weapons, and tons of Black Mesa to explore. Everything great about the first Half Life is still here with the fast moving enemies and fluid combat. This is much more expansive than Blue Shift but shorter than Half Life with my total play time clocking in at around five hours. This is a fantastic game and cements Half Life's incredible legacy even further.

AÃºn no terminÃ© de jugarlo, asÃ­ que probablemente edite esta reseÃ±a mÃ¡s tarde.
Opposing Force es otro juegazo. Si bien es un Half-Life, se siente distinto al original por las siguientes razones:
-Hay mayor variedad de enemigos (Algunos son mucho mÃ¡s desafiantes que los del primer juego).
-Mayor variedad de armas, dÃ¡ndote mÃ¡s opciones en un tiroteo, o incluso en resolver ciertos problemas.
-Los puzzles se vuelven MUCHO mÃ¡s simples, no sÃ© si es por el bien del jugador, la apariciÃ³n de carteles repetitivos que te dicen quÃ© hacer, o si fue solo el hecho de que agarrÃ© mÃ¡s experiencia al terminar HL1 con sus puzzles.
-El diseÃ±o de los mapas (Black Mesa) tiene mucho mÃ¡s sentido que anteriormente, aunque sigue habiendo tonterÃ­as como depÃ³sitos de cajas cada medio capÃ­tulo.
-Da una visiÃ³n amplia del lado rival y ''malvado'', los HECU, al contrario que en Half Life, que todos usan el mismo uniforme y una misma funciÃ³n
-etc.
9.5/10

Overall a great expansion to Half Life that a lot of people sleep on.

Pros:
+New and interesting weapons which bring new ways to play to the table
+New enemies
+Solid level design
+Compelling alternate perspective of the Black Mesa Incident

CONS:
-New enemies are annoying as fuck
-The game is IMPOSSIBLE on hard without extreme save scumming
Some sections of the game are pretty dumb (i.e. the entire sewer section)

Conclusion: Overall a great expansion to the original Half Life, though it has issues with difficulty. 

8/10
